properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Warning issued February 2 at 2:11PM PST until February 3 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Steep seas of 11 to 14 feet dominated by northwest swell
at 12 seconds are expected through early this evening, becoming
steep to very steep 13 to 15 ft at 12 to 13 seconds late this
evening through early Monday morning. Then steep seas of 10 to
14 ft at 12 seconds are expected late Monday morning through
Monday night.

* WHERE...All areas will be affected by conditions hazardous to
small craft through early this evening and again late Monday
morning through Monday night. Very steep warning level seas will
affect areas beyond 5 nm from shore and near Cape Blanco late
this evening through early Monday morning.

* WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Steep seas could cause smaller vessels to capsize.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Recreational boaters should remain in port. Commercial vessels
should prepare for very steep seas and consider remaining in port
until conditions improve.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM PST MONDAY
